classFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|FGO|bucklers} and {@item sword cane|FGO|sword canes}.

classFeature.name: Countercharm
entries: {@i 6th-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Countercharm feature

Starting at 6th level, your magnificent presence disrupts mind-influencing effects. You and each creatue of your choice within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or charmed. You must be consious grant this bonusand a creature must be able to hear or see you to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with one exotic weapon of your choice.

classFeature.name: Step of The Wind
entries: {@i 2nd-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Step of the Wind feature}

As a bonus action, you can take the Disengage or Dash action and your jump distance is doubled for the turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest.
Alternatively, you can expend 1 ki point to use this feature.

classFeature.name: Perfected Self
entries: {@i 20th-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}, which replaces the Perfected Self feature
At 20th level, you become a paragon of self control. Your Dexterity and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

classFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level rogue {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|FGO|bucklers}, {@item scimitar||scimitars} and {@item sword cane|FGO|sword canes}.

items: A bleeding creature takes {@damage 1d10} piercing or slashing damage (depending on the cause of the wound) at the start of its turn.
A creature within 5 feet of the bleding creature (including itself) can take an action to stop the bleeding.
A creature also stops bleeding when it receives magical healing.
A fatigued creature is {@condition weakend|FGO} and has disadvantage on all saving throws.
A frozen creature is {@condition incapacitated} and can't move or speak.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
The creature has vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.
If the creature takes any amount of fire damage the condition ends on it.

condition.name: Weakend
entries: A weakend creature has disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks.

feat.name: Apothecary
entries: Your relentless tinkering with herbs and studying of medicine gives you the ability to create medical pastes and small amounts of potions.

When you finish a long rest, you can create medical paste. As an bonus action, a creature can apply this paste, instantly regaining hit points equal to your proficiency bonus or curing itself from one poison affecting it.
You make enough paste for a number of doses equal to your proficiency modifier.

feat.name: Far Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Far Realm's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell detect thoughts} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=e;t} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=e;t} must be from the enchantment or transmutation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Hemomancy Novice

prerequisite.other: The ability to use an arcane or druidic focus as a spellcasting focus

entries: You've learned to use vile magic using your own blood as a catalyst:

items: You learn two spells from the hemomancy spell list.
Instead of expending spell slots to cast your spells, you can expend a number of hit dice equal to the spells level and roll them. When you do so:
You take damage equal to the number rolled (can not be reduced in any way).
Your spellcasting ability for this casting becomes Constitution.
You can only do this with spells of 3rd level or lower that are on the hemomancy spell list.

feat.name: Hemomancy Adept
entries: You have deepend your knowledge of blood magic:

items: You can now cast hemomancy spells of 4th level or lower using hit dice instead of spell slots.
You learn two spells from the hemomancy spell list.
While {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell cast using hit dice, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain {@status concentration}.

feat.name: Hemomancy Master
entries: You have finished your studies on hemomancy:

items: You can now cast hemomancy spells of 5th level or lower using hit dice instead of spell slots.
You learn two spells from the hemomancy spell list.
you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your hemomancy spells cast using hit dice.

feat.name: Hemomantic Rejuvenation
entries: You have found a way to offset the costs of your hemomancy.
At the end of a short rest you can gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} to regain half of your hit dice.

feat.name: Rover
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet, and you gain a climbing speed and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

feat.name: Rune Knight Initiate
entries: You learned to carve runes imbued with magic. As a result, you learn one rune of your choice from among the runes available to rune knights.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a objects equal and inscribe the rune onto the objects. To be eligible, an object must be a weapon, a suit of armor, a shield, a piece of jewelry, or something else you can wear or hold in a hand. Your rune remains on an object until you finish a long rest.
If a rune requires a saving throw, your Rune Magic save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.
Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace this feat's rune with another one available to the rune knight.

item.name: +1 Brass Bracelet
entries: While wearing this bracelet, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage roll made of your unarmed strikes.

item.name: +1 Feral Kilt
entries: This kilt is made from fur of various apex predators. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +1 bonus to your rage damage and unarmored defense.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed towards a hostile creature.

item.name: +2 Brass Bracelet
entries: While wearing this bracelet, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage roll made of your unarmed strikes.

item.name: +2 Feral Kilt
entries: This kilt is made from fur of various apex predators. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +2 bonus to your rage damage and unarmored defense.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed towards a hostile creature.

item.name: +3 Brass Bracelet
entries: While wearing this bracelet, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage roll made of your unarmed strikes.

item.name: +3 Feral Kilt
entries: This kilt is made from fur of various apex predators. While wearing this magic item, you gain a +3 bonus to your rage damage and unarmored defense.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to move up to your movement speed towards a hostile creature.

item.name: Aleta
entries: This magic weapon looks like the snout of a swordfish and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

Instead of making a melee weapon attack with this sword, you can make a ranged weapon attack against a creature within 60 feet of you. This attack launches a small swordfish from the tip of the blade toward the target.

item.name: Arden Gauntlets
entries: These gauntlets made of crude iron appear very old and have scratches and cracks all over them. One singular multicolored gemstone is embedded into the back of each individual gauntlet. They are fabled to have been created by Ard, the orrean god of war and destruction.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the arden gauntlets, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls of your melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes.

The gauntlets have 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dusk. When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can expend 2 charges and use your reaction to give yourself resistance against the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Furthermore, the gauntlets absorbs an amount of energy from the attack equal to the roll of {@dice 1d6}. Once they have absorbed 15 points of one damage type, the gauntlets gain the ability to empower your strikes with the absorbed element. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend up to 3 charges. For the first charge you expended, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} damage of the absorbed type and an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the absorbed type for each additional charge. The Gauntlets lose all absorbed energy when you end your attunement with them.

entries.name: Awakend
entries: When the Arden Gauntlets reach an awakened state, they gain the following properties:

items: The bonus to attack and damage rolles of your melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes increases to +2.
You can use the gauntlets properties on necrotic damage.
You can expend up to 4 charges when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike.
Your weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal double damage to objects and structures

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the gauntlets reach an exalted state, they gain the following properties:

items: The gauntlets gain 5 additional charges and now regain {@dice 1d10 + 5} expended charges instead of {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges.
The bonus to attack and damage rolles of your melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes increases to +3.
You can use the gauntlets properties on radiant damage.
As an action, you can produce an effect similar to the {@spell destructive wave} spell (save DC 17). Once you use this property of the gauntlets, you can't use it again until the next dusk.

item.name: Armor of Iron Bands
entries: The gauntlets and bracers of this armor are made of coils of rusty iron bands.

While wearing the armor, you have advantage on grapple checks. In addition, you can increase the reach of your grapple by reducing your AC as the iron bands expend towards your target. When you do so, the reach for your grapple increases by 5 feet for each point you reduce your AC. Your AC stays reduced until your grapple ends.

item.name: Arms of Ceird
entries: This beautifully crafted box is made of walnut with two ornated leather straps fixed to it. The box is supposed to be worn like a backpack. It is fabled to have been created by Ceird, the orrean god of craft.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The Arms of Ceird grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: While wearing the Arms of Ceird, you gain a +1 bonus to any ability check you make using a tool.
If you are an artificer, you can use the box as a spellcasting focus.
The box has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d3 + 1} charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend 1 charge and cast {@spell Catapult|XGE} from the box.

As a bonus action, you can let two beautifully carved wooden arms sprout from the box for 1 hour. They are fully functional, can hold weapons and perform somatic components for spellcasting. The arms have a Strength score of 17 and otherwise use your ability scores.

entries.name: Awakend
entries: When the Arms of Ceird reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The bonus to ability checks increases to +2.

The box gains 2 additional charges and now regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges instead of {@dice 1d3 + 1} expended charges. In addition, you can expend 2 charges and cast {@spell Tiny Servant|XGE} from the box.
The Strength score of the wooden arms increases to 19.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the Arms of Ceird reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The bonus to ability checks increases to +3.

The box gains 2 additional charges and now regains {@dice 1d5 + 3} expended charges instead of {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges. In addition, you can expend 3 charges and cast {@spell Creation} from the box.

The Strength score of the wooden arms increases to 21. In addition, when you use the boxes bonus action, a propeller sprouts from the top side of the box granting you a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

item.name: Blowing Viper
entries: This blowgun is beautifully crafted to look like a venomous snake and you can pour poisons into a little reservior on the blowgun.

After you have poured three doses of one kind of poison in the blowing viper, the poison becomes stored. Poisons that need to be ingested to take effect can not be poured in. The blowgun has serpent venom already stored in it.

The blowgun has 10 charges and regains 1d6 + 4 charges daily at dusk. When you attack using the blowing viper, you can expend up to 4 charges. When you do so choose a poison stored in the blowgun. If the chosen poison affects a creature on contact or injury, it is applied to the blowguns ammunition. If the chosen poison needs to be inhaled to affect a creature, it is emitted in a 5-foot cone from the blowgun. The DC for the poison is equal to 2 times the expended charges plus 10.

item.name: Bottled Lightning
entries: In this bottle floats a blue glowing orb. Bolts of lightning lash out from the orb to the bottle whenever someone touches the bottle.

As an action, you can remove the stopper of the bottle unleashing the stored lightning in a 100 feet long and 5 feet wide line in the direction the bottle is facing or you can throw the bottle at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. The bottle shatters on impact unleashing the stored lightning in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes damage according to the type of lightning stored in the bottle on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The DC for the saving throw is determined by the type of the stored lightning.

item.name: Bracers of Jolting
entries: While you are attuned to the bracers, you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

In Addition, you can move through conducting objects and creatures as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, but you can't end your movement in it. When you move through a creature for the first time on your turn, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} lightning damage.

item.name: Cloak of Stepping
entries: This cloak has 6 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3 + 3} expended charges daily at dawn. Wile wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action and expend 1 charge of the cloak to create an effect similar to the *misty step* spell or you can use an action and expend 2 charges of the cloak to create an effect similar to the *thunderstep* spell (save DC 15).

item.name: Cloak of the Mole
entries: While wearing this cloak with its hood up, you have a burrowing speed of 30 feet and {@sense tremorsense|MM} out to 10 feet. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

item.name: Elemental Quiver
entries: This quiver flickers with elemental energies. It has space for 10 pieces of ammunition and any piece placed in it has a chance of absorbing some of the elemental energies of the quiver. After a piece of ammuntion has been within the quiver for at least one hour, roll a {@dice d6}. The ammunition turns into an elemental piece of ammunition as noted in the Elemental Quiver table.
Some elemental quivers only produce one kind of elemental ammunition.

item.name: Emblem of Golden Bones
entries: The emblem can be used as a spellcasting focus.

As an action while holding the emblem, you can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell requiring no material components to summon a {@creature magma mephit} or {@creature smoke mephit} (your choice) without expending a spell slot.

item.name: Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 5-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Flask of Acid
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

item.name: Flask of Alchemist's Fire
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 fire damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Flask of Dry Ice
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} cold damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 5 feet until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the dry ice.

item.name: Flask of Greater Acid
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

item.name: Flask of Greater Alchemist's Fire
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Flask of Greater Dry Ice
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the dry ice.

item.name: Flask of Greater Holy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a fiend or undead, it takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the holy water.

item.name: Flask of Greater Unholy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a celestial, it takes {@damage 3d8} force damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the unholy water.

item.name: Flask of Holy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a fiend or undead, it takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 radiant damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the holy water.

item.name: Flask of Oil
entries: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.
On a hit, the target is covered in oil. The target is vunerable to fire damage until the oil dries (after 1 minute) or it takes any amount of fire damage.

You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 1 minute and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

item.name: Flask of Superior Acid
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

item.name: Flask of Superior Alchemist's Fire
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

item.name: Flask of Superior Dry Ice
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d4} cold damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the dry ice.

item.name: Flask of Supreme Holy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. item.name: Flask of Unholy Water
entries: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

On a hit, if the target is a celestial, it takes {@damage 1d8} force damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 force damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the unholy water.

item.name: Greater Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 10-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Greater Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Googles of Day
entries: While wearing these dark lenses, you ignore the sunlight sensitivity feature if you have it.

item.name: Heart of Darkness
entries: This pitch black heart with cracks glowing red hot is still beating. It belonged to a powerful solar before the demon lord Kalzifar ripped it out of the Solars chest and transformed it into a focus for his powers.

entries.name: Magic Item
entries: The heart can be used as an arcane focus and grants a +3 to spell attacks and a +1 to spell save DCs. It also functions as a {@item pearl of power}

entries.name: Benefical Properties
entries: While you are attuned to the heart, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to fire damage. If you already have resistance to fire damage, you gain an immunity to fire damage instead. If you already have a fire immunity, you regain hit points equal to half the fire damage you would have taken.
You gain advantage on saving throws against spell effects.

entries.name: Detrimental Properties
entries: While you are attuned to the heart, you suffer the following detrimentals:

items: Any good aligned celestials recognizes you as a hostile creature.
There is a 10% chance, that an avatar of {@deity Tyr} will come after you.

entries.name: Abyssal Fire
entries: When you cast a spell using the heart as a spellcasting focus, you can use your reaction to ignore resistance to fire damage on one target of the spell.

entries.name: Ars Ignis
entries: When you cast a spell that deals fire damage using the heart as a spellcasting focus, one target of the spell catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire with holy water, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage at the start of each of its turns for the next {@dice 1d6} rounds.

entries.name: Spells
entries: The heart has 7 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dusk. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18) from it: {@spell fireball} (1 charge), {@spell wall of fire} (1 charge), {@spell immolation} (2 charges), {@spell fire storm} (3 charges), {@spell incendiary cloud} (3 charges), {@spell meteor swarm} (4 charges).
While attuned to the heart, Kalzifar can cast the heart's spells using 2 fewer charges (minimum of 0). In addition, he gains the following traits:

entries.name: Fire Reflection
entries: Whenever Kalzifar is subjected to fire damage, the damage is reflected back at its origin.

entries.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless Kalzifar chooses to, he is not affected by spells of 6th level or lower.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: Kalzifar gains 2 extra uses of his legendary resistance trait and 2 extra legendary actions.

entries.name: Destroying the Heart
entries: To destroy the heart of darkness, it must be impaled on the spear of the solar, the heart belonged to, dripping with a unicorns blood on top of a high peak in Mercuria, the second layer of mount celestia. It must remain there for 101 years. After this time it stops beating and loses all of its properties.

item.name: Ikarian Portal Mirror
entries: An ikarian portal mirror is a large object consisting of several floating silver shards and was used by the ikarians for quick transportation and communication.

Each Mirror has a designated location connected to it. While attuned to the mirror and within 30 feet of it, you can transform the mirror into a portal to its connected location for 10 minutes or until you use an action to close it.

Furthermore, as an action while within 10 feet of the mirror, you can name one person. If the person is on the same plane of existance as you, they appear in the mirror and you can talk to them as if they were standing next to you.
Once every seven days, you can cast {@spell gate} opening the portal in the mirror. However, you can not draw creatures through the portal.

item.name: Iron Coin
entries: This coin is made of cold iron an has the symbol of carceri embossed onto it. Six of these coins exist, but only two were found so far in an ancient ruin as part of an expedition. Each of the coins holds a powerful balor in service of the demon lord kalzifar.

As an action, a creature holding the coin can speak its command word and free the balor from its prison. If a creature speaks the balors true name instead of the command word, the balor has to obey the creatures verbal command to the best of its abilities for the next hour. After that time, the balor will start attacking the creature that uttered its name.

item.name: Kaladbolg
entries: This sword is made of a pitch black metal, with ruby inlays on its silver crossguard. Long ago, Kaladbolg was the weapon of a chosen paladin of cord, the goliath mearok, and was used by him to seal away the ancient evil known as ylgred. Ylgred's remnance, however, still lingers in the sword waiting to break out of its prison.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: Kaladbolg grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The sword also functions as a sword of sharpness.

The sword has 3 charges and regains all- expended charges daily at dusk. When you hit a creature with Kaladbolg, you can expend 1 charge of the sword and choose either acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage. Your attack deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage of the type you chose. If you have no charges left you can still use this property by taking necrotic damage equal to the extra damage you dealt. When you do so, your hit point maximum is reduced by an equal amount to the damage you took.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Kaladbolg awakens only after it has caused 45 points of necrotic damage to its wielder. Once the sword reaches an awakend state, it gains the following properties and becomes sentient:

items: Kaladbolg becomes a vorpal sword instead of a sword of sharpness.
The extra damage increases to {@dice 3d6}.
If Kaladbolg has no charges left and you use it, roll a {@dice d10}. If you roll a 1, roll on the Kaladbolg Surge table to create a magical effect.

entries.name: Abandoned
entries: Once ylgred's remnance abandones Kaladbolg, it gains the following properties and is not sentient anymore:

items: Kaladbolg has 5 charges, but it can not be used without charges anymore.
Kaladbolg regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} charges daily at dusk.
The extra damage increases to {@dice 3d8}.

entries: You can cast {@spell absorb elements|XGE} from Kaladbolg. You can use this feature twice and regain all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Kaladbolg Surge
rows: A black tentacle launches from a portal within a 30-foot radius sphere of you at a random creature within 120 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and become {@condition grappled}. A grappled creature gets pulled 10 feet towards the portal at the and of each of your turns until it enters the portal. The portal closes afterwards.
You transform into a {@creature quasit} for 1 minute.
A demon chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of you. It is hostile towards you and your allies and disappears after 1 minute.
A slaad chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.

item.name: Master's Blindfold
entries: A singular eye is painted on this blindfold made of velvet. While you wear this blindfold over your eyes and attuned to it, you are {@condition blinded}, but you gain blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.

item.name: Meteorite Mask
entries: This mask is made of pure meteorite and has a long curved beak with purple glowing runes carved into it. So far any attempt at identifying the mask has failed. Unknown to all, the masks purpose was worshipping an ancient god of chaos and corruption, ylgred.
Any creature that has the mask in its posession hears incomprehensible mumbling.

Any creature that tries to attune to the mask has to succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the creature {@damage 4d10} psychic damage and gains the following personality flaw: "I am constantly arguing with the voices in my head." On a failed save, the creature suffers the effects of a feeblemind spell and becomes a thrall of Ylgred.

If an unattuned creature puts on the mask, it takes {@damage 10d10} psychic damage and suffers the effects of a feeblemind spell as the mumbling becomes unbearably loud and the creatures mind is flooded with forbidden eldritch knowledge.
While attuned to the mask and wearing it, you can't be {@condition charmed} or frightend by anyone except Ylgred itself and you gain the following features:

entries.name: Abberant Ward
entries: If an abberation targets you directly with an attack or a harmful spell, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or it must choose a new target or forfeit targeting someone instead of you, potentially wasting the attack or spell. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours. An abberation is also immune to this effect for 24 hours if you target it with an attack or a harmful spell.

entries.name: Otherworldly Gaze
entries: As an action, you gain {@sense truesight} out to a range of 30 feet for 1 minutes. After you use this feature, you are {@condition blinded} for the next hour and you can't use it again until dusk of the next day.

entries.name: Forbidden Lore
entries: The meteorite mask has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dusk. While wearing the mask, you can expend 1 of its charges to cast the {@spell legend lore} spell. By using the mask to cast {@spell legend lore}, you communicate directly with ylgred, and they shares their knowledge with you.

Wearing the mask strains the mind of a creature. After an hour of wearing the mask, you must repeat the saving throw you made when first attuning to it. In addition, on a failed save, you become unattuned to the mask.

item.name: Mirror Shield
entries: While attuned to the shield, you have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid being {@condition blinded}.

In addition, when you are subjected to a spell of 5th level or lower that targets only you, you can use your reaction and attempt to throw the spell back. When you do so, make a Charisma check against the casters spell save DC. On a success, the spell is thrown back at its caster, affecting him as if you had cast the spell.
You can use this feature twice and regain expended uses daily at dawn.

item.name: Obsidian Boots
entries: While wearing the boots, you can't be knocked {@condition prone} and you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain||3} made of earth or stone without expending extra movement.
In addition, you can walk over lava as if it was {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

item.name: Pallad
entries: A *pallad* is a small silvery oval stone. If the stone is targeted directly by a spell of 6th level or lower, the spell has no effect, but is instead stored within the *pallad*. If the stone is included in the area of effect of a spell of 6th level or lower, there is a {@chance 50|50 percent} chance that the spell is absorbed into the pallad.
As an action, a creature can crush a pallad that absorbed a spell or throw it at a point within 40 feet. The stored spell is then released using the statistics of the original caster.

item.name: Rings of Platinum
entries: These five Rings are made of the finest platinum and appear to never get dirty or stained. The ring is ornamented multiple gemstomes, each with a different kind. To be able to use the Rings, one must wear all of them at the same time. They are fabled to have been created by Rachma, the orrean goddess of wealth.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the Rings of Platinum, your Charisma score increases by +1 up to a maximum of 19.

The rings can store wealth to fuel there magic with it. Daily at Dawn, if they have stored less than 300gp, the rings stored wealth resets to 300gp. At any time on your turn, you can store more wealth in the rings. When you do so, valuables, such as coins or gemstones, worth the amount you want to store disappear from your person. You can only store as much wealth as you have on your person.

As a bonus action, you can expend up to 300gp stored within the rings to invoke the magic of the rings on a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. When you do, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced by 5 feet for each 50 gp you expended for 1 minute, as platinum jewelry appears on the target for the duration weighing it down. If this reduces the targets speed to 0, it is also knocked {@condition prone} and automatically fails Dexterity saving throws for the duration. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

entries.name: Awakend
entries: When the Rings of Platinum reach an awakened state, they gain the following properties:

items: The bonus to your Charisma score increases to +2 up to a maximum of 21.

As an action, you can expend 500gp stored to cast one first level spell from the cleric spell list (save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks) without expending a spell slot. You can use this property twice and regain all expended uses daily at dawn.
The save DC of the rings properties increases to 15.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the Rings of Platinum reach an exalted state, they gain the following properties:

items: The bonus to your Charisma score increases to +3 up to a maximum of 23.
When you fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction and expend up to 500gp stored within the rings to gain a bonus to the saving throw equal to +1 for each 100gp expended.
You can use the rings to cast a cleric spell trice instead of twice.
The save DC of the rings properties increases to 17 and the spell attack bonus increases to +9.

item.name: Skjaersilden
entries: Long ago, the dwarven blacksmith and high priest of tharmekhl bork loderr created the axe out of obsidian and adamantine to honor his patron deity. Tharmekhl was pleased with the result and bestowed his blessing upon the axe and bork, creating the artifact now known as Skjaersilden.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: Skjaersilden is a magic weapon that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The axe also functions as a {@item belt of dwarvenkind} and a {@item sword of sharpness}.

entries.name: Benefical Properties
entries: While you are attuned to the axe, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to fire damage
You gain proficiency with smith's tools
Your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage and an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage

entries.name: Detrimental Properties
entries: While you are attuned to the axe, you gain the following detrimentals:

items: You take {@damage 4d10} fire damage when you become attuned to the artifact.

You gain a horrible burn scar whereever the axe made contact with you while attuning, giving you disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks and advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as {@spell heal} or {@spell regenerate} , remove the scar
An avatar of {@deity Tharmekhl} will try to find you, in order to find out if you are worthy of the axe.

entries.name: Blessing of Tharmekhl
entries: If you are a dwarf attuned to the axe and deemed worthy by Tharmekhl, you gain the following benefits:

items: When you are hit with an attack that deals fire damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself immunity to fire damage until the start of your next turn. After you use this feature, roll a d6, on a roll of 1-4 you can't use this feature again until the next dawn.
Your {@sense darkvision} can see through magical darkness.
The scar you got from attuning to the axe turns into a tribal tattoo, giving you advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks you make against dwarves.
The bonus fire and radiant damage the axe deals increases to {@dice 1d10} each.

entries.name: Conjure Fire Elemental
entries: While you are holding the axe, you can use your action to cast the {@spell summon elemental|TCE} spell from it, summoning a fire elemental. You can't use this property again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Arson
entries: When you first attune to the axe, you gain a permanent character flaw: "I have the compulsion to set the world on fire." You can remove this flaw by the means of a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: As an action, you can throw the Smoke Bomb at point within 30 feet of you. The bomb then detonates. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

The bomb create a 15-foot-radius sphere of smoke centered on the point where it detonated. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

item.name: Superior Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 15-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Superior Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 15-foot radius must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Supreme Flashstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the flashstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 20-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Supreme Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 20-foot radius must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Surgeon's Tools
entries: Skill at surgery enables a character to treat injuries more effectively. A surgeon can mend broken bones, patch up wounds and remove parts of a body.

entries.name: Components
entries: Surgical tools include a scalpel, a needle, thread, sanitizer, bandages, salves, splints, pincers, and a magnifying glass.

item.name: Thunderstone
entries: As an action, you can throw the thunderstone at a creature, object or point on a solid surface within 30 feet of you, shattering it on impact. If you are able to make multiple attacks, you can substitute one of the attacks with this action.

Each creature in a 5-foot radius must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

item.name: Tiara of the Sea Empress
entries: While you are attuned to the tiara, you can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}, you can enter a hostile creature's space and move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
In addition, when you are hit by an attack that deals nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to give yourself immunity to the damage of that attack.

item.name: Tolling Bell
entries: As an action, you can chime the bell. When you do so, you cast {@spell toll the dead|XGE} (1st level, DC 13) on every creature within 30 feet of you that can hear the bell.

item.name: Transdimensional Dagger
entries: This dagger seems to fade in and out of the ethereal plane in random intervals.

Immediatly after you threw the dagger, you can use a bonus action and teleport yourself to the dagger. When you do so, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space of the dagger and it reappears in your hand.

item.name: Tristorme
entries: This tricorne appears to be made of shark skin with a lining of blue silk. It is decorated with several seashells and corals. It is fabled to have been created by Aigerd, the orrean god of storms and the sea.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While you are wearing the tricorne, you have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

Furthermore, the Tristorme has 5 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. When you make a ranged weapon attack, you can expend 1 charge to empower the attack with the hats magic. When you do so, the attack gains one of the following effects (your choice):

items: The ammunition or thrown weapon used for the attack turn into a lightning bolt. The target of the attack takes an extra {@damage 2d10} lightning damage and each creature in a straight line that is 5 feet wide between you and the target must make DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 2d10} lightning on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The weapon emits a loud noise, audible up to 300 feet away, on impact with its target. Each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d10} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: As a bonus action, you can invoke the tricornes magic. When you do so, strong magical winds blow araound you in a 10 feet radius and move with you for 1 minute. The area is considered difficult terain for everyone except yourself and all ranged weapon attacks except your own that would pass through the area are made with disadvantage. You can use this property twice and regain all expended uses daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakend
entries: When the Tristorme reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: You have a swimming speed of 45 feet.
The tricorne now has 6 charges.
The save DC and damage of the tricorne increase to 15 and {@damage 3d10} lightning or thunder damage.

While you are surounded by the hats magical winds, you have a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. In addition, all ranged spell attacks except your own that pass through the winds area are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the Tristorme reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: You have a swimming speed of 60 feet.
The tricorne now has 7 charges.
The save DC and damage of the tricorne increase to 17 and {@damage 4d10} lightning or thunder damage.
A creature within the area of the hats magical winds has advantage on saving throws against spells.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Rune
entries: This rune overflows with the raw magical energy of eldritch giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you gain a bonus to all Intelligence (Arcana) checks and Intelligence (History) checks you make regarding magic or magic items equal to your proficiency bonus.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage from a spell, you can use your reaction to invoke this rune and give the creature resistance to that damage until the start of its next turn.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Curse Rune
entries: This rune bears the magic that once cursed some giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated.

In addition, you can invoke this runes magic as a bonus action unleashing the fomorian curse onto one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become cursed with magical deformities for 1 minute or until you lose conentration (as if concentrating on a spell).

While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity. A cursed creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn ending the effect on a successful one.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fog Rune
entries: This rune channels the innate stealthiness of fog giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by fog or mist.

In addition, you can invoke this rune as a bonus action covering you in a small cloud of mist. For 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it, you gain a +1 bonus to your armor class and you are lightly obscured.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain Rune
entries: This rune gives you the might of mountain giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}, {@skill Survival}) checks that rely on smell.

In addition, when you walk at least 10 feet towards a creature in a straight line and then attack it with a melee weapon attack, you can invoke this rune tackling the creature as part of your attack. It must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Runt Rune
entries: This rune evokes the ferociousness of two headed giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you must make a saving throw against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned} or being knocked {@condition unconscious}, you can use your reaction to invoke this rune and give the creature advantage on the saving throw.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Trickery Rune
entries: This rune grants you the intellect of human behemoths. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you gain a bonus to Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Deception}) checks equal to your Constitution modifier.

In addition, when you miss a creature with a weapon attack, you can invoke this rune giving you a bonus to the attack roll equal to your constitution modifier, potentially turning the miss into a hit.
Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Brute
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 30 seconds
For the potions duration, you gain advantage on all melee weapon attacks that use strength. In addition, all attacks against you have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Bull's Eye
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

optionalfeature.name: Cold
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to fire damage. In addition, you don't suffer the effects of extrem heat.

optionalfeature.name: Day
entries: Toxicity: 2
Duration: 2 hours
For the potions duration, you gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Durable
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Ground
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Leach
entries: Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Regena
entries: Toxicity: 8
Duration: 10 minutes
For the potions duration, at the start of your turn, when you have at least 1 hit point left, but no more than half your hit point maximum, you regain hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Sight
entries: Toxicity: 4
Duration: 2 hours
For the potions duration, you gain the effects of the {@spell see invisibly} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Steadfast

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 4
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you can't be {@condition stunned} or knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Stone

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Thick Hide
entries: Toxicity: 2
Duration: Instantaneous
You gain {@dice 1d4+4} temporary hit points.

entries.name: Higher Potency
entries: You gain additional 5 temporary hit points for each additional 2 points of toxicity you take.

optionalfeature.name: Warmth

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 hour
Toxicity: 6
Duration: 1 hour
For the potions duration, you gain resistance to cold damage. In addition, you don't suffer the effects of extrem cold.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind

entries.name: Duration
entries: 1 minute
Toxicity: 8
Duration: 1 minute
For the potions duration, you can take the {@action dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn. In addition, you gain a +2 to your AC and your speed increases by 10 feet.

A booming arrow is a magic weapon infused with thunder magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away is created and the creature and each creature with in 10 feet of it must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is deafend for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't deafend. A deafend creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.
Once a booming arrow deals damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A corroding arrow is a magic weapon infused with acid magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature has acid splashed over it; until someone takes an action to wipe of the acid, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} acid damage at the start of each of each of its turns. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the creature is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal hit by the arrow is disolved in 1 round.
Once a corroding arrow splashes a creature or an object, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A flame arrow is a magic weapon infused with fire magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. If you hit a flammable object with the arrow the object ignites.
Once a flame arrow ignites a creature or an object, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A frigid arrow is a magic weapon infused with ice magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, becoming {@condition frozen|FGO} until the end of its next turn on a failed save. If you hit water with the arrow, the water freezes in a 5-foot cube for 1 minute.
Once a frigid arrow forces a creature to make a saving throw, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

A shocking arrow is a magic weapon infused with lightning magic. If a creature takes damage from the arrow, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, becoming {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn on a failed save. If the arrow hits an object that can conduct electricity, its effect extends to any creature touching the object.
Once a shocking arrow stuns a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.
This weapon returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack.

Melee weapons or ammunition made of cold iron are unusually effective against demons and fey. Attacks made with a cold iron weapon ignore resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks of any demon or fey hit by them.
The cold iron version of a melee weapon costs twice as much as the normal version.

Melee weapons or ammunition made of or coated with mithral are unusually effective against celestials. Attacks made with a mithral weapon ignore resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks of any celestial hit by them.
The mithral version of a melee weapon costs 300 gp more than the normal version, whether the weapon is made of the metal or coated with it.

Any shield with spikes implanted into its front is called a spiked shield. A spiked shield can be used as a martial melee weapon and deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. If you successfully shove a creature using the shield, the creature takes the damage of the shield in addition to the shoves normal effect.
The spiked version of a shield costs 10 gp more than the normal version.
Serrated blades are designed to inflict more gruesome wounds.

Any martial weapon dealing slashing damage except for whips can have serrated versions. When you hit a creature with a serrated blade, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC for this save equals 10 + your proficiency bonus.
On a failed save, a creature starts bleeding and takes {@damage 1d10} slashing damage at the start of each of its turns until it or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to quench the wound.
The serrated version of a weapon costs 15 gp more than the normal version.

This sword is made of a pitch black metal, with ruby inlays on its silver crossguard. Long ago, Kaladbolg was the weapon of a chosen paladin of torm, the goliath mearok, and was used by him to seal away the ancient evil known as ylgred. Ylgred's remnance, however, still lingers in the sword waiting to break out of its prison.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: Kaladbolg grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The sword also functions as a {@item sword of sharpness}.

The sword has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dusk. When you hit a creature with Kaladbolg, you can expend 1 charge of the sword and choose either acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage. Your attack deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage of the type you chose. If you have no charges left you can still use this property by taking necrotic damage equal to the extra damage you dealt. When you do so, your hit point maximum is reduced by an equal amount to the damage you took.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Kaladbolg awakens only after it has caused 45 points of necrotic damage to its wielder. Once the sword reaches an awakend state, it gains the following properties:

items: Kaladbolg becomes a {@item vorpal sword} instead of a {@item sword of sharpness}.
The extra damage increases to {@damage 3d6}.
If Kaladbolg has no charges left and you use it, roll a {@dice d10}. If you roll a 1, roll on the Kaladbolg Surge table to create a magical effect.

entries.name: Abandoned
entries: Once Kaladbolg becomes abandoned, it gains the following properties and is not sentient anymore:

items: Kaladbolg has 5 charges, but it can not be used without charges anymore.
Kaladbolg regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dusk.
The extra damage increases to {@damage 3d8}.
You can cast {@spell absorb elements|XGE} from Kaladbolg. You can use this feature twice and regain all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Kaladbolg Surge
rows: A black tentacle launches from a portal within a 30-foot radius sphere of you at a random creature within 120 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and become {@condition grappled}. A grappled creature gets pulled 10 feet towards the portal at the and of each of your turns until it enters the portal. The portal closes afterwards.
You create a permanent 30-foot radius sphere antimagic field.
You transform into a {@creature quasit} for 1 minute.
A demon chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of you. It is hostile towards you and your allies and disappears after 1 minute.
A slaad chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell grease} centered on yourself.

hp.special: 2 + your Intelligence modifier + five times your artificer level (the deucalion has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your artificer level)

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
entries: If the deucalion takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The deucalion is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form from anyone other than you.

action.name: Strike
entries: {@atk mw} your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage (your choice when you create the deucalion).

action.name: Corrosive Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage, plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Volatile Spittle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The elemental can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Chilling
entries: A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@dice 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Frost Burst {@recharge 4}
entries: The elemental releases cold air around it in a 5-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage and has disadvantage on its next attack roll. On asuccessful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the koguhpuk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the koguhpuk can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The koguhpuk deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the koguhpuk fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The koguhpuk makes one Gore attack and one Stomp attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The koguhpuk exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is also {@condition frozen|FGO} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The koguhpuk moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Stomp
entries: The koguhpuk makes one Stomp attack.

legendary.name: Trunk Sweep (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The koguhpuk sweeps its trunk in a 20-foot cube. All creatures in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, or take 23 ({@damage 2d12+10}) bludgeoning damage plus 6 ({@damage 1d12}) cold damageand is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The racoon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

action.name: Sacred Spittle
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage or 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage if the target is an undead or a fiend.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The dragon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

action.name: Poison Breath
entries: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 11d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Blinding Breath
entries: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or can't see the dragon for 1 minutes. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The dragon makes one claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Outmaneuver
entries: The dragon moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries: The dragon magically mocks a creature that it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.

entries: The dragon exhales a beam of temporal energy in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 52 ({@damage 8d12}) necrotic damage and is weakend until the end of its next turn. A weakend creature has disadvantage on all {@dice d20} tests. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

At the start of its next turn, the target reappears where it was or in the closest unoccupied space. The target doesn't remember being affected by this ability.

entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

entries: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:

action.name: Poison Breath
entries: The greatwyrm exhales poisonous gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw, taking 104 ({@damage 24d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Blinding Breath
entries: The greatwyrm exhales poisonous gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or can't see the dragon for 1 minutes. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack

legendary.name: Outmanouver
entries: The greatwyrm moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Draconic Mockery (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm magically mocks a creature that it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.

entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

entries: The greatwyrm unleashes a magical roar. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 3d12}) thunder damage and be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 15 ({@damage 3d10})  fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't catch fire.

monster.name: Temporal Greatwyrm

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food, drink or air.

trait.name: Temporal Mastery
entries: The greatwyrm chooses its place in the initiative order instead of rolling.

trait.name: Planar Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon and Temporal Shunt, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Planar Awakening activates.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage, plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) force damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Temporal Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales a beam of temporal energy in a 150-foot line that is 15 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 91 ({@damage 14d12}) necrotic damage and is weakend until the end of its next turn. A weakend creature has disadvantage on all {@dice d20} tests. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

bonus.name: Temporal Step
entries: The greatwyrm magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 90 feet of it.

reaction.name: Temporal Shunt {@recharge 6}
entries: When a creature the greatwyrm can see makes an attack roll or casts a spell, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature vanishes, being thrown to another point in time and causing the attack to miss or the spell to be wasted. At the start of its next turn, the target reappears where it was or in the closest unoccupied space. The target doesn't remember being affected by this ability.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Shift Initiative (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm alters time around a creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw (the creature can choose to fail) or have its initiative count increased or decreased (the greatwyrms choice) by 4 ({@dice 1d8}).

legendary.name: Time Ravage (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm casts {@spell time ravage|EGW} requiring no spell components and using Constitution as its spell casting ability.

entries: The nazim has advantage on saving throws to avoid or end diseases affecting you.

Until the oil dries (after 1 minute) or is ignited, any creature entering the space for the first time on their turn must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If ignited, the oil burns up immediatly.
