action.name: Alchemical Inventions
entries: The alchemist uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a {@dice d6}); the alchemist can use each one no more than once per day:

items.name: 1: Acid
entries: The nazim hurls a *flask of acid*. *Ranged Weapon Attack:* {@hit 4} to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. *Hit:* 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 acid damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the acid.

items.name: 2: Alchemist's Fire
entries: The nazim throws a *flask of alchemist's fire*. *Ranged Weapon Attack:* {@hit 4} to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. *Hit:* 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 fire damage until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to extinguish the falmes.

items.name: 3: Dry Ice
entries: The nazim throws a *flask of dry ice*. *Ranged Weapon Attack:* {@hit 4} to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. *Hit:* 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage. In addition, at the start of each of its turn, the target takes 1 cold damage and its speed is reduced by 5 feet until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the dry ice.

items.name: 4: Flashstone
entries: The nazim throws a *flashstone* at the target or point within 30 feet of them, shattering the stone on impact. Each creature in a 5-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

items.name: 5: Thunderstone
entries: The nazim throws a *tunderstone* at the target or point within 30 feet of them, shattering the stone on impact. Each creature in a 5-foot radius must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

items.name: 6: Smoke Bomb
entries: The nazim throws a {@item smoke bomb|FGO} at a point they can see within 30 feet of them.The bomb create a 15-foot-radius sphere of smoke centered on the point where it detonated. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

entries: The nazim makes two Mace attacks.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage while raging.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Rage (1/Day)
entries: The nazim enters a rage until the end of its next turn gaining the following benefits:

items: The nazim has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
The nazim gains a +2 bonus to damage rolls made using Strength (included in the attack).
The nazim has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The nazim has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Dagger
entries: Melee  or Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is small.

entries.name: Keen Nose
entries: You have Advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on smell and you can try to detect hidden creatures via smell. In addition, you can detect poisons in food or drink by smell.

entries.name: Nimble Physique
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill Acrobatics} skill. In addition, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Sleepyhead
entries: Dorucs require more sleep than over creatures. You need to sleep for at least 10 hours per day. However, you still gain the benfits of a long rest if you only rest for 8 hours. But if you go for more than 24 hours without sleeping for at least 10 hours, you have to succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. This level of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by sleeping for at least 10 hours.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Your nocturnal nature grant to better vision in dark enviroments. You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 120 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Floral Nature
entries: You can cast the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip at will. In addition, while you are in direct sunlight and have access to carbondioxide, you don't need to eat or breathe.

entries.name: Frenzy
entries: The toxins in your body can turn you into a fierce berserker. As a bonus action, you can enter a frenzied state for 1 minute granting you the following benefits:

items: At the start of each of your turns, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.
While moving towards a hostile creature, your speed is increased a number of feet equal to 5 times half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).
Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

entries: While frenzied, however, you can not concentrate on spells and have disadvantage on Wisdom and Intelligence saving throws. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You are proficient in medium armor, shields and one martial weapon of your choice.

entries.name: Toxic Sap
entries: Instead of blood, toxic sap is running through your veins. When a creature ingests the sap or is hit by a weapon dealing piercing or slashing damage that is coated by the sap, it must make a Constituion saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the creature is {@condition poisoned} and enters a frenzied stated similar to your frenzy feature for 1 minute. However, the creature doesn't gain temporary hit points suffering {@damage 1d6} poison damage at the start of each of its turns instead. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Talons
entries: You have talons that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Gifted
entries: When you finish a long rest, you gain proficiency in your choice of the {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Religion} skill, a tool or a musical instrument. You retain this proficiency until you finish your next long rest.

entries.name: Ikarian Recall
entries: Thanks to your supernaturally good memory, you have proficiency in two skills of your choice. Moreover, when you make an ability check using any skill in which you have proficiency, you can give yourself advantage on the check before rolling the d20. You can give yourself advantage in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} within 60 feet of you as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} and in darkness as if it were {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light}. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

In addition you can focus yourself on your fine nose and keen hearing. As a bonus action, you gain {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 15 feet until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Nazimian Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end diseases affecting you.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a walking speed of 30 feet and a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your base AC is 13 + Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Nimbleness
entries: Your fishy ancestry has made you more nimble. You have proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} skill and advantage on Dexterity checks and Saving throws you make to end the {@condition Grappled} condition on yourself.

spell.name: Blood Puppet
entries: You try to exert control over the blood of a humanoid or beast you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be affected by this spell. An affected creature is {@condition paralyzed} for the spells duration, but can still concentrate on spells, speak. In addition, as a bonus action, you can force an affected creature to move up to half its speed and make one weapon attack. At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can repeat its saving throw.

components.m: a piece of silk thread and a needle

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid or beast for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 15 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Boiling Blood
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. You cause the creatures blood to boil. For the spells duration, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage at the start of each of its turns, falls {@condition prone} and has disadvantage on all {@dice d20} tests. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make a Constitution saving throw ending the effects of the spell early on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Chaos Cloud
entries: You shoot forth a knot of roiling ethereal light that explodes at a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Coagulant Thorns
entries: You summon sharp spikes made of coagulated blood in a 20-foot radius centered on a point on the ground within range. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d10} piercing damage and starts {@condition bleeding}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't start bleeding.

spell.name: Catch Lightning

time.condition: which you take when you see a lightning within 60 feet of you

m.text: a bottle or a similar container, which the spell consumes

entries: You attempt to catch a lightning inside a bottle. If the lightning is caused by a spell of 3rd level or lower or a natural lightning, it is cought in the bottle. If the lightning is caused by a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the lightning is cought in the bottle. A cought lightning takes the most direct way possible to you still affecting creatures in the way. If you catch a lightning it creates a bottled lightning. Your DM may allow you to catch other lightning effects such as the lightning breath of a blue dragon, comparing the effect to a spell of an appropriate level or setting an individual DC appropriate for the effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can catch lightning created by a spell of an equal or lower level of the spell slot you used without making an ability check.

spell.name: Dread Meadow
entries: The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point you can see within range becomes overgrown with dark purplish to blackish vegetation, so called dread weed. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration and each creature that starts its turn there or enters the area for the first time on its turn and isn't a construct, plant or undead must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature suffers one effect from the following table:

rows: The creature takes {@damage 2d10} poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for the duration. A {@condition poisoned} creature takes {@damage 1d10} poison damage at the start of each of its turns and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
The creature becomes {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

The creature becomes {@condition restrained} and must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition petrified} for the duration. On a successful save, the creature is no longer restrained. If the creature is {@condition petrified} for the full duration of the spell, it stays {@condition petrified} until cured.

spell.name: Greater Aversion to Energy
entries: You attempt to shatter the elemental resistances of a creature you can see within range. Choose one type of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder.
The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have vunerability to the chosen type for the duration of the spell.
An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the start of its turn.

spell.name: Inflict Madness

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 3rd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with short-term madness for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Lesser Aversion to Energy
entries: You attempt to weaken the elemental resistances of a creature you can see within range. Choose one type of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder.
The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take an additional {@damage 1d8} damage of the chosen type whenever it takes damage of the chosen type.
An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the start of its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the additional damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Positive Energy Flood

components.m: chalk and a circle of white silk

entries: You send ribbons of positive energy at one creature you can see within range. Unless the target is undead or a construct, it regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 5d8}.
If you target an undead with this spell, it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Watery Slash
entries: You hurl a pressurized blade of water at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Wilbun's Tentacle Arm
entries: You touch the arm of a willing creature turning it into a slimy tentacle. Until the spell ends, the creature can use its action to make a melee attack with the tentacle. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which the creature is proficient. It deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage plus {@damage 1d4} acid damage and has the light and reach properties. In addition, you have advantage on grapple checks using the tentacle.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the acid damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Wilbun's Words of Weirdness
entries: You flood a 30-foot cube centered on a point you choose within reach with energies from the far realm. As a bonus action, while the cube is within 300 feet of you, you can move it up to 60 feet.

When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d10 psychic damage and suffers a short-term madness for 10 minutes. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and doesn't suffer a short-term madness. At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can repeat the saving throw, taking 4d10 psychic damage on a failed save, or ending the madness on a successful one.
In addition, any spell cast within the cube triggers a wild magic surge. Roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to determine the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Demiurg
entries: TODO

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item surgeon's tools|FGO}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Demiurg Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Demiurg Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Deucalion
entries: By 3rd level, your experiments have spawned a horrible abomination, a {@creature deucalion|FGO}. It is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the deucalion stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine the creature's appearance and whether it has two legs or four; your choice has no effect on its game statistics.

In combat, the deucalion shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the deucalion can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

At the end of a long rest, you can create a new deucalionif you have your {@item surgeon's tools|FGO} with you. If you already have a deucalion from this feature, the first one immediately perishes. The deucalion also perishes if you die.
When you gain this feature, choose one of the following traits. Your deucalion gains that trait.

items.name: Aquatic
entries: The deucalion gains a swimming speed of 30 feet and the ability to breath underwater.

items.name: Spider Climb
entries: The deucalion gains the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving its hands free. It also gains a climbing speed of 30 feet.

items.name: Tunneler
entries: The deucalion can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and gains a burrowing speed of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Senses
entries: Starting at 3th level, you have created a strong psychic bond with your deucalion. As an action, you can see through your deucalion's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the deucalion has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

In addition, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your deucalion can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your deucalion must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Deucalion
entries: At 5th level, you gave your deucalion some more improvements. When you gain this feature, your deucalion gains the following trait:

items.name: Multiattack
entries: The deucalion makes two strike attacks or one strike attack and uses the action it gained at 5th level.
In addition, choose one of the following actions. Your deucalion gains that action.

items.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC equals your spell save DC) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the deucalion can't use the same tentacle on another target. The deucalion has two tentacles.

items.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} your spell attack modifier to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h} The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

items.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} your spell attack modifier to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} piercing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Deucalion
entries: At 9th level, your experiments further altered the physiology of your deucalion. When you gain this feature, choose one of the following traits. Your deucalion gains that trait.

items.name: Cloying Miasma
entries: The deucalion is surrounded by a noxious stench. At the start of the deucalion's turn, any creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or be poisoned until the start of the deucalion's next turn.

items.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the deucalion or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes acid damage equal to your intelligence modifier. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the deucalion corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to 5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the deucalion is destroyed after dealing damage.

items.name: Echolocation
entries: The deucalion gains blindsight out to a range of 30 feet. The deucalion can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Deucalion
entries: At 15th level, your mastery of body modifications grants your deucalion additional abilities. When you gain this feature, it gains immunity to lightning damage and the following trait.

items.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the deucalion is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to half of the lightning damage dealt.
In addition, choose one of the following traits. Your deucalion gains that trait.

items.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deucalion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

items.name: Regeneration
entries: The deucalion regains a number of hit points equal to your proficiency modifier at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

items.name: Tough Hide
entries: The deucalion gains a +2 to its Armor Class and has resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Time Domain
entries: The Time Domain is a sacred calling for clerics who revere deities of time, and who seek to understand and manipulate the forces that govern the past, present, and future. These clerics are masters of time, able to bend its flow to their will and use its power to serve the divine.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte of Time
entries: When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the {@spell sapping sting|EGW} cantrip if you don't already know it. This cantrip doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know.
In addition, the {@spell reality break|EGW} and {@spell time ravage|EGW} spells are added to the cleric spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Alertness
entries: You can add your Wisdom modifier to your initiative rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Time Manipulation
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinty to manipulate the time of other creatures.
When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you rolls initiative, you can use your reaction to give that creature advantage or disadvantage on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Swap
entries: At 6th level, at the start of your turn (before any other effects are resolved), once per round, you can attempt to swap the initiative of to creatures you can see within 60 feet of you. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect.
If you change your own initiative with this, the rest of your turn is resolved at your new initiative count and the creature you swapped with immediatly takes its turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Acceleration
entries: Starting at 8th level, you learned to accelerate your own time. As a bonus action, you gain the benefits of the {@spell haste} spell until the end of your next turn. However, after this effect ends on you, you gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

subclassFeature.name: Time Stop
entries: At 17th level, your mastery of time lets you stop it temporarily. On your turn, you can take one additional action.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Corsair
entries: With each passing wave, a paladin who has taken the Oath of the Corsair is reminded of their sacred duty. They know that the sea is a treacherous place, but they are determined to protect all who venture upon its waters.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

entries.name: Oceanic Adaption
entries: You can use your channel divinity to adapt to the vast ocean. As an action, you can expend one use of your channel divinity and give a number of creature up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one) that you can see within 30 feet of you a swimming speed of 30 feet and the ability to breath under water for up to 1 hour as long as you are not incapacitated.

entries.name: Striking Wave
entries: Immediately after you deal damage to a creature with your Divine Smite feature, you can expend one use of your channel divinity and force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Seafaring Proficiencies
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with navigator's tools and {@filter vehicles (water)|items|type=vehicle (water)}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Corsair Spells
rows: {@spell create or destroy water}, {@spell fog cloud}

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Corsair
entries: A paladin who assumes the Oath of the Corsair pleadges their life to the sea

entries.name: Camaraderie
entries: Your camarades are your life. Protect them and share whatever you may find.

entries.name: Mercy
entries: Mercy is the right of everyone. Be merciful even to your enemies.

entries.name: Freedom
entries: Let nothing tie you down. You belong to the world and the world only.

subclassFeature.name: Tempest Smite
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain the ability to use your divine smite feature on ranged weapon attacks. In addition, your smites can deal lightning or thunder damage instead of radiant damage (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Raging Sea
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal lightning damage to the attacker equal to your paladin level. The attacker must also make a Strength saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Sea
entries: You can empower yourself with the might and rage of the sea. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You gain resistance to cold, lightning and thunder damage.
You gain a swimming speed  of 60 feet and the ability to breath under water.

As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see with in 30 feet of you. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. The target takes {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone, as if struck by a wave.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: The Greatwyrm

entries.caption: Dragon Family
rows: Black, Blue, Brown, Green, Grey, Purple, Red, White, Yellow
Adamantine, Brass, Bronze, Cobalt, Copper, Gold, Iron, Mercury, Silver, Steel
Amethyst, Crystal, Emerald, Obsidian, Sapphire, Topaz

entries: TODO

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Greatwyrm lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The Greatwyrm Expanded Spells table shows the greatwyrm spells that are added to the warlock spell list for you, along with the spells associated in the table with your patron's family: chromatic, metallic, gem or planar.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Affinity
entries: Some of your patrons magic empowered you. Starting a 1st level, you can read, speak and write draconic and you gain resistance to the damage type associated to your patron.

subclassFeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: At 6th level, as a bonus action, you can exhale destructive energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide or a 15-foot cone (your choice). Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d10} damage of the type affiliated with your patron. You can use this feature a number of time equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest. Alternatively, you can expend one of your warlock spell slots to immediatly regain all expended uses of this feature.
This feature's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 11th level ({@damage 3d10}) and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Greatwyrm
entries: At 10th level, your Patron bestowed some of its power onto you. You gain one of the following features depending on the family of your patron:

entries.name: Frightful Presence
entries: As an action, you can force each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you and aware of you to succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Psychic Step
entries: As a bonus action, you magically teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries: You don't require food or air.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Transformation
entries: Starting at 14th level, you learned to manifest some of your patrons magic. As a bonus action, you manifest draconic features like scales and wings. When you do so, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.
you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
You breath weapon deals an additional 1d10 damage and its area increases to a 90-foot line or a 60-foot cone.
Immediatly after you assume your draconic form, you can use your breath weapon once.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest, unless you expend one of your warlock spell slots to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Brute
entries: Some barbarians deem it unsatisfying to maul there foes with weapons. They think it is way better to simple bash in heads with their bare hands. Barbarians like this follow the Path of the Brute.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmed Attacks
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier on a hit.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you.

While raging, the damage die of your unarmed strikes increases to {@damage 1d8} and the damage you can deal to a grappled creature increses to {@damage 1d6}. In addition, you can make one grapple attempt as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: Starting at 6th level, while raging, your unarmed strikes and the damage you deal to a grappled creature count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Discombobulate
entries: At 10th level, you learned to discombobulate creatures with your unarmed strikes. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Choke Hold
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can try to strangle a creature grappled by you. Once per turn, as an attack on your turn while raging, you can force a creature grappled by you to make a Constitution saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. An {@condition unconscious} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: College of Dancing
entries: Members of the College of Dancing dedicated themselves to the art of dancing. They have learned to use there swift movements to inspire or dace others.

subclassFeature.name: Gracious Combat
entries: When you join the College of Dancing at 3rd level, you learn how to use certain weapons in a more graceful and swift way and your nimble movements allow you to doge attacks.

For you, quaterstaffs, sickles and spears gain the finesse property. Futhermore, while you are not wearing any armor or using a shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Dance
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your dance can inspire others.

As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to inspire a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The inspired creature can use its reaction to take the dodge action, move up to its movement speed or make a weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Rousing Dance
entries: At 6th level, you can use your action to start dancing. If you do so, choose one creature within 60 feet of you that you can see, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save the creature starts dancing wasting its next turn in the process. On your subsequent turns, you can use your bonus action to sustain the dance. A dancing creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn to end the effect early. The creature is immune if it can't see you or it is immune to being charmed.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master's Dance
entries: Starting at 14th level, whenever you use your Inspiring Dance feature, you gain the benefits of the dodge action.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Ferocity
entries: Druids of the Circle of Ferocity embrace the untaimed nature of the wilderness. These Druids channel primal magic through their own bodies to aid them in combat and turn them into beasts themself. They learned to grow bestial features and fight with the savagery of a wild animal when threatened.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your connection to the wilderness grants you access to certain spells. At 2nd level, you learn the primal savagery cantrip. At 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th level you gain access to the spells listed for that level in the Circle of Ferocity Spells table.

Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Ferocity
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain the ability to manifest a natural weapon. As an action, you can manifest your natural weapon and immediatly make one melee weapon attack with it and you can dismiss the weapon at any time (no action reqiured). You choose the weapons form when you gain this feature:

subclassFeature.name: Claws
entries: Each of your hands transforms into a claw, which you can use as a weapon if it's empty and deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a claw attack, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or start bleeding on a failure. A bleeding creature takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage at the start of of its turns until it or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to quench the wound.

subclassFeature.name: Fangs
entries: You grow venomous fangs in your mouth, which deal {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a fang attack, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC taking {@damage 2d10} poison damage and becoming poisoned for 1 minute on a failure. A poisoned creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn in order to end the effect early.

subclassFeature.name: Horns
entries: You grow a pair of pointy horns, which deal {@damage 1d10} piercing damage on a hit. If you move at least 15 feet straight towards a target an then hit it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tail
entries: You grow a lashing, clubbed tail, which deals {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage on a hit and has the reach property. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a tail attack, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw be pushed 10 feet back.

subclassFeature.name: Feral Form
entries: At second level, you learned to channel your ferocity with your magic. As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your wild shape feature and tranform into your feral form. When you do so, you gain temporary hitpoints equal to twice your proficiency bonus and the following properties:

items: At the start of your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder damage (your choice when you enter your feral form).

entries: This form lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or you use a bonus action on your turn to end it.
The extra damage increases by {@damage 1d4} when you reach 6th level ({@damage 2d4}), 10th level ({@damage 3d4}) and 14th level ({@damage 4d4}) in the druid class.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Strikes
entries: Starting at 10th level, attacks with your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage while in your feral form.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Movement
entries: Starting at 14th level, your feral form grants you additional mobility. While in your feral form, you have a swimming speed or a climbing speed equal to your walking speed (your choice when you gain this feature). In addition, you can use a bonus action on your turn to expend one spell slot and increase your walking speed your walking speed by an amount equal to five times the spell's slot level.

subclassFeature.name: Strider
entries: Striders dedicate their life to hunting monsters and often sell their skills to townsfolk in need of a monster hunter. They augment their martial prowess with a special form of alchemy granting them abilities that mimic their prey. However, striders need to mutate their own bodies in order to endure the toxic potions they brew. Because of this, most common folk mistrust striders and most of their orders were driven to the fringes of society.

subclassFeature.name: Strider Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Strider Lore
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies. Furthermore, instead of sleeping for 8 hours, you can enter a deep meditational trance for 4 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemy
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to create {@filter strider potions|optionalfeatures|feature type=SF}. These potions are posionous to everyone that is not a strider.

entries.name: Preparing Formulae and using Mixtures
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you prepare a number of formulae equal to your Wisdom modifier + your fighter level divided by three. The formulae must be for potions. Preparing the formulae reflects four hours of brewing as part of your long rest, creating the mixtures you will use until your next long rest. As a bonus action on your turn, you can ingest a potion gaining its benefits, but increasing your toxicity level. If you use the same potion twice their effects don't stack.

entries.name: Toxicity Level and Toxixity Limit
entries: When you ingest a potion, your toxicity level increases by an amount noted in the formula. Your toxicity limit determines how high your toxicity level can get without suffering any drawbacks. When your toxicity level exceeds your toxicity limit, you take an amount of d10s of poison damage equal to the formulas toxicity cost ignoring resistances and immunities and your hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the poison damage you took. After you reduced your toxicity level below your toxicity limit, you can restore your hit point maximum using a greater restoration spell or similar magic. Additionally, you become poisoned until your toxicity level no longer exceeds your toxicity limit.When you finish a long rest, your toxicity level is reduced back to zero.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Oils
entries: At 7th level, you learned to create oils for your blades. As part of a short or long rest you can coat one melee weapon that deals slashing or piering damage with a special oil.

When you do so, choose one of type of creature: Abberations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, montrosities, plants or undead. When you hit a creature of the chosen type with the coated weapon, your attack counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage and the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier). On a failed save, the creature takes an extra {@damage 2d6} acid damage.
The weapon stays coated until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Special Ingredient
entries: At 10th level, you can add one of three special ingedients to your potions.

When you ingest a potion, you can choose one of the following effects to gain in addition to the potions normal effect. After you chose one ingredient, you can't choose that ingredient again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Giant's Toe
entries: You added a bit of a giant's toe to your potion giving you a +3 to all strength based damage rolls you make within the next minute.

entries.name: Troll Blood
entries: You added a bit of a troll's blood. At the start of your turn, when you are not incapacitated and have not taken acid or fire damage this round, you regain an amount of hit points equal to your fighter level divided by three (rounded down) for the next minute.

entries.name: Celestial Liver
entries: You added a bit of a celestial's liver reducing your toxicity level by an amount equal to your fighter level divided by three (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Eye
entries: At 15th level, your knowledge about monsters grants you insight into a creatures defenses. Once, on your turn, you can choose a creature you can see and make a Wisdom (Insight) check (no action required). On a success, you gain insight into the targets hit points, vunerabilities, resistances and immunities and you have advantage on your next attack against the target. The DC for this check equals 10 + half the targets challenge rating (rounded down).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficieny bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Angel's Tear
entries: At 18th level, you learned how to create a special potion.
As an action, you can ingest that potion reducing your toxicity level to zero and ending all potion effects on you. After you used this feature, you can't use it again unit you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Jester
entries: Jesters are masters at hand-eye-coordination and use cunning to play their opponents like a fiddle. They constantly insult their enemies while chugging knives at them and dodging their attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Throws
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.
In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Taunt
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned to focus the anger of your opponents onto you. As an bonus action, you can start taunting a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. At the start of its turn, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus) or it can't target any creature other than you with an attack or harmful spell until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours. A creature immune if it can't see or hear you or if it's immune to being charmed.

subclassFeature.name: Juggling
entries: Starting at 9th level, as a bonus action, you can start juggling a number of weapons equal to your proficiency bonus until you end it as a bonus action. The weapons must have the thrown and light properties, both your hands must be free to use this feature and you can't use the dash action for the duration. When you use the attack action while juggling, you can make a number of attacks equal to your proficiency bonus divided by 2 (rounded down) throwing weapons you are juggling. Your juggling ends early when you have thrown all weapons you were juggling.

When you attack with one of the weapons, you can try to add a new weapon to your juggling. When you do so, make a Dexterity saving throw. The DC is equal to 12 + the number of weapons you are currently juggling. On a failed save, your jugging ends and all juggled weapons fall to the ground in front of you. On a successful save, the weapon is added to your juggling.

When you take damage while juggling, you have to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + half the damage taken + the number of juggled weapons) or your juggling ends and the juggled weapons fall to the ground.

subclassFeature.name: Nasty Insults
entries: Starting at 13th level, you learned to use your knowledge of people in a different way. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you targets you directly with an attack, you can use your reaction and give the creature disadvantage on the attack roll. A creature is immune to this feature if it can't hear you or if it's immune to being charmed.
You can use this feature a number this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Suprising Throws
entries: Starting at 17th level, you have advantage on any ranged weapon attack that you make using a weapon with the thrown property.

subclassFeature.name: Gambler
entries: Gamblers have the bad habit of taking risks regardless of the circumstances. However, they seem to be unbelievably lucky succeeding against even the worst of odds.

subclassFeature.name: Wager
entries: At 3rd level, you start to wager with your abilities. You can give yourself a bonus to one ability check, attack roll or saving throw you are about to make. You choose the bonus, but it can't be higher than half your proficiency bonus. When you do so, the next ability check, saving throw or attack roll you make is reduced by an amount equal to the bonus you gave yourself. You have to decide on using this feature before you roll the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Fool's Proficiency
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one other type of gaming set of your choice. You also gain proficiency in the Sleight of Hand skill or another skill of your choice from the list of skills available to rogues at 1st level, if you are already proficient in the Sleight of Hand skill.

subclassFeature.name: Lucky Seven
entries: Starting at 9th level, your luck aids you in your exploits. When you make an ability check or saving throw and roll a natural seven, you automatically succeed on the roll. In addition, when you make an attack roll and roll a natural seven, you score a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Gambler's Luck
entries: Starting at 13th level, your lucky nature can turn a failure into a success. When you make an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, you can reroll the d20 and must use the new roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficinecy bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Risky Gambit
entries: Starting at 17th level, when you deal your sneak attack damage to a creature and you roll a 1 or 2 on a sneak attack die, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or 2. When you do so, attack rolls against you have advantage until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Guardian
entries: The Oath of the Guardian is a solemn vow taken by paladins who feel a deep sense of responsibility to protect others. Those who take this oath dedicate themselves to acting as protectors for anyone who needs their help, even if it means putting their own lives on the line.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

entries.name: Divine Protection
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you gets hit by an attack, you can use your reaction and expend a use of your channel divinity. When you do so, you can reduce the damage the creature takes by an amount equal to 1d10 + your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Heroic Intervention
entries: When a creature within 15 feet of you gets targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction and expend one use of your channel divinty. When you do so, you become the target of the attack instead.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Shields
entries: At 3rd level, when you swear this oath, you gain the ability to use shields more vesatile. You can effectively use two shields simultaniosly. However, you only gain +1 to your AC for the second shield. In addition, you can use any shield as a light martial melee weapon dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage on a hit.
The damage of this attack increases when you reach certain levels in this class: 1d6 when you reach 7th level, 1d8 when you reach 15th level and 1d10 when you reach 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Guardian Spells
rows: {@spell circle of power|XGE}, {@spell wall of force}

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Guardian
entries: A paladin who persues the Oath of the Guardian swears to act as a protector for anyone who needs their help.

entries.name: Protection
entries: Always protect those in need of protection.

entries.name: Vigilance
entries: Stay aware of your surroundings. A Threat could present itself at any time.

entries.name: Sacrifice
entries: Put the well-being of others before your own well-being.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Vigilance
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your vigilance helps you protect those around you. Attack rolls against all creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you have disadvantage
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shield Charge
entries: Starting at 15th level, as an action, you can move up to your movement speed in a straight line moving through the space of any medium or smaller creature in your path. The first time you enter a creature's space during this movement, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 30 feet. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Sentinel
entries: At 20th level, you can become a paragon of protection. As a bonus action, you can magically enter this form, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: Any critical hit against you counts as a normal hit instead.
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage.
Each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you gains half cover.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

entries.name: Ice Walk
entries: You can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, {@quickref difficult terrain||3} composed of ice or snow doesn't cost you extra movement.

entries.name: Cold Resistance
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Break the Ice
entries: You know the {@spell frost bite} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell frost fingers|IDRotF} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell rime's binding ice|FTD} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast {@spell frost fingers|IDRotF} or {@spell rime's binding ice|FTD} with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Magma Walk
entries: You can move over molten rock and lava as if it was {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. In addition, you don't take fire damage from any superheated surface you are touching.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Volcanic Eruption
entries: You know the {@spell create bonfire|XGE} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell searing smite} spell with this trait. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell heat metal} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast {@spell searing smite} or heat metal with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Amorphous
entries: You can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided you are wearing and carrying nothing. You have advantage on ability checks you make to initiate or escape a grapple.

entries.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You have resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Oozing
entries: You know the {@spell primal savagery|XGE} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell grease} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the acid arrow spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast {@spell grease} or acid arrow with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Smoke Vision
entries: Fog, smoke and similar phenomena don't impede your vision.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Smoked
entries: You know the {@spell poison spray} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell fog cloud} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell dust devil|XGE} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast {@spell fog cloud} or dust devil with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Doruc

entries.name: Size
entries: Herrings tend to be smaller than other Piscans. Your Size is Small.

entries.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: When you are targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction to give yourself a bonus to your AC equal to the number of friendly creature within 5 feet of you (maximum of +5). You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your Size is Medium.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill, and you count as one size larger when determining your carrying weight and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your Size is Medium.

entries.name: Agile
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

variantrule.name: Bard Optional Features
entries: You gain class features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} when you reach certain levels in your class. This section offers additional features that you can gain as a bard. Unlike the features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, you don't gain the feature automatically. Consulting with your DM, you decide whether to gain the feature in this section if you meet the level requirement noted in the feature's description.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|FGO|bucklers} and {@item sword cane|FGO|sword canes}.

entries.name: Countercharm
entries: {@i 6th-level bard {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Countercharm feature}

Starting at 6th level, your magnificent presence disrupts mind-influencing effects. You and each creatue of your choice within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or charmed. You must be consious grant this bonusand a creature must be able to hear or see you to gain this benefit.

variantrule.name: Rogue Optional Features
entries: You gain class features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} when you reach certain levels in your class. This section offers an additionalfeature that you can gain as a rogue. Unlike the features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, you don't gain the feature automatically. Consulting with your DM, you decide whether to gain the feature in this section if you meet the level requirement noted in the feature's description.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level rogue {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with {@item buckler|FGO|bucklers}, {@item scimitar|PHB|scimitars} and {@item sword cane|FGO|sword canes}.

variantrule.name: Monk Optional Features
entries: You gain class features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} when you reach certain levels in your class. This section offers an additionalfeature that you can gain as a monk. Unlike the features in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}, you don't gain the feature automatically. Consulting with your DM, you decide whether to gain the feature in this section if you meet the level requirement noted in the feature's description.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: {@i 1st-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
You are proficient with one exotic weapon of your choice.

entries.name: Step of the Wind
entries: {@i 2nd-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Step of the Wind feature}

As a bonus action, you can take the Disengage or Dash action and your jump distance is doubled for the turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest.
Alternatively, you can expend 1 ki point to use this feature.

entries.name: Perfected Self
entries: {@i 20th-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Perfected Self feature}
At 20th level, you become a paragon of self control. Your Dexterity and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.
